ROOFING
1] Water spots on the ceiling, leaking
2] Damaged or missing shingles
3] Damaged flashing around chimneys, dormers, walls, and in valleys
4] Buckled or blistered shingles,
When you should contact a roofing professional...
What you can do to greatly improve the life of your roof...

1] Perform an annual inspection to repair, recaulk and repaint any areas where
cracking of cornerboards and trim is evident above roof areas
2] Regularly inspect and clean gutters
3] Regularly inspect and clean crickets and cornerboard trim behind fireplaces
4] Regularly inspect and seal at plumbing vents, gas pipes and attic vents
If you have an active leak during a storm...

1] Immediately use a screwdriver of other similiar object to create a hole in the
drywall where the water is actively dripping (this will help minimize water damage
to the structure)
2] Place a bucket directly under the hole to catch any water that will drain out
main
exterior
interior
